Cryptopals Challenge 5

This cryptopals challenge asks us to implement a cipher similar to the Vign√®re cipher, repeating key XOR.

A simple implementation here is to simply encrypt the plaintext byte-by-byte by XORing against the key

def xor_line(key, pt):
    # key and pt are bytes objects
    # apply key bytewise
    res = b''
    for i in range(len(pt)):
        res += bytes([key[i % len(key)] ^ pt[i]])
        return res

Encrypting and decrypting here are symmetric in the sense that both are done by applying the same operation, here is an example of what encrypting would look like using the provided text and key:

print(xor_line(b'ICE', b"Burning 'em, if you ain't quick and nimble\nI go crazy when I hear a cymbal").hex())
# > 0b3637272a2b2e63622c2e69692a23693a2a3c6324202d623d63343c2a26226324272765272a282b2f20430a652e2c652a3124333a653e2b2027630c692b20283165286326302e27282f
